column3: Oil and candles alike were scarce, and there was little but the moon's rays to disclose a town to the eye. The rejoicings over the victory had brought more people than usual into the streets, but the same exultation made them unsuspicious, and Dick glided among them in the dusk, almost without fear.

column2: He had concluded that "the longest way around was the shortest way through," and he directed his steps toward the river.
column3: He had concluded that "the longest way around was the shortest way through," and he directed his steps toward the river.

column2: He had formed a clear plan at last, and he believed that it would succeed.
column3: He had formed a clear plan at last, and he believed that it would succeed.

column2: Twisting and turning, always keeping in the shadows, he made good progress, descended the bluff, and at last stood behind the ruins of an old warehouse near the stream.
column3: Twisting and turning, always keeping in the shadows, he made good progress, descended the bluff, and at last stood behind the ruins of an old warehouse near the stream.

column2: Southern batteries were not far away from him and he heard the men talking.
column3: Southern batteries were not far away from him and he heard the men talking.

column2: Then, strengthening his resolution, he came from behind the ruins, flung himself almost flat on the ground, and crawled toward the river, pushing in front of him a board, which some Northern gun had shot from the warehouse.
column3: Then, strengthening his resolution, he came from behind the ruins, flung himself almost flat on the ground, and crawled toward the river, pushing in front of him a board, which some Northern gun had shot from the warehouse.

column2: He knew that his task was difficult and dangerous, though in the last resort he could rush to the water and spring in.
column3: He knew that his task was difficult and dangerous, though in the last resort he could rush to the water and spring in.

column2: But he was almost at the edge before any sentinel saw the black shadow passing over the ground.
column3: But he was almost at the edge before any sentinel saw the black shadow passing over the ground.

column2: A hail came, and Dick flattened himself against the ground and lay perfectly still.
column3: A hail came, and Dick flattened himself against the ground and lay perfectly still.

column2: Evidently the sentinel was satisfied that his fancy had been making merry with him, as he did not look further at the shadow, and Dick, after waiting two or three minutes, resumed his slow creeping.
column3: Evidently the sentinel was satisfied that his fancy had been making merry with him, as he did not look further at the shadow, and Dick, after waiting two or three minutes, resumed his slow creeping.

column2: He reached the edge, shoved the board into it, and dropped gently into the water beside it, submerged to the head.
column3: He reached the edge, shoved the board into it, and dropped gently into the water beside it, submerged to the head.

column2: Then, pushing his support before him, he struck out for the middle of the stream.
column3: Then, pushing his support before him, he struck out for the middle of the stream.
